column5: text
"Why hello there. I'm a busy women so I do hope you are contacting me for a good reason"

column4:
SetTooltip tahlan_startTurnInSilvys "You do not have any blueprints in your possession."
SetEnabled tahlan_startTurnInSilvys false

column6: 1:tahlan_silvysContactOption:"I was told your department offers lucrative work."
15:tahlan_startTurnInSilvys:"I heard you might be interested in recovered blueprints."
10:tahlan_startTurnInCoresSilvys:"I'd like to turn in these AI cores that I've acquired..."
100:tahlan_neverMindSilvys:"Oh I'm sorry, I don't actually have any."

column5: "Memory getting hazy already? Do take care with that."
"Indeed. My department is always all too thankful for such contributions to our efforts."

"You are correct. Due to the STDF's strictly defensive mission statement, I am forced to rely on independent contractors to get work done in the sector beyond this system. Plausible deniability and all that.

According to what we have on record about you, you should fit right in. Feel free to inquire about open contracts at any time when in system."
"While that is correct, these contracts serve our military interests and I can't just offer them to anyone, you know. I'd suggest making some more friends with the Protectorate authorities first."
$personLastName moves the conversation on to other matters. "Anything else you need?"
"A dangerous commoditiy you have on your hands there, but we can take these off your hands discretely for an adequate compensation. The Protectorate thanks you, Captain."

"Well, well, well, what do we have here. I'd have quite a few applications for these things, not that I would ever go against the ban on AI Core use, of course. No, never, but shall we talk about prices?"
$PersonRank $personLastName thanks you ever so politely and the conversation moves on to other matters.
$PersonRank $personLastName has some of her assistants collect the cores and swiflty moves the conversation along on to other topics.

"Is this some kind of joke, citizen? If you are who you are claiming to be, you'd be on several top-level Ministry wanted lists. In fact, I'm going to have to report this entire conversation to Hegemony COMSEC."

"You're already commissioned by $theOtherCommissionFaction. I don't know if loyalty means anything to you, citizen, but it is a core pillar of our values. You would have to resign that commission before you'd even be considered for commission as an auxiliary by the Hegemony."
"You do not meet the criteria for receiving a commission, citizen."

"Hmm, Fleet Intelligence has been watching you for some time it seems, and it says here that you clear the checks.

Accepting a commission with the Hegemony is a serious matter, citizen. You will be required to fight enemies of the Hegemony and assist in upholding law and order where the official apparatus cannot reach. Above all, you will dedicate yourself to fighting for the restoration of the Domain over human space.

I must inform you that you have the right to resign your commission at any time. And while there have been honorable circumstances for resignation in the past, between us, let me add that doing so would be considered highly suspicious by Fleet Intelligence, to say nothing of what the loyal Hegemony officer corps would think.
"By the power invested in me by the office of the High Hegemon, I offer you commission as auxiliary to the Hegemony Navy. Do you wish to sign on?"
"Excellent! Welcome to the service."
"Is there anything else I can do for you, citizen?"

"Yes, not everyone has the strength of character to uphold the values of the Hegemony to the standards that are required. The Sector has need of merchants and shuttle pilots, after all. Those are also honorable careers in their own small way.

Anything else I can do for you?"

"Do you affirm to that, citizen, and agree that your recorded affirmation stand as record of your commitment? The Hegemony needs people it can rely on, and if you were to let us down it would not soon be forgotten."
"I see. At least you were brave enough to tender your resignation in person."

"A good decision. Despite what dissident agitprop may claim, the Hegemony does not ask blind obedience. It takes courage to first question then choose to re-affirm a commitment. We can use people like you in this troubled age."
